Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Core Decompression with Autologous Osteoblastic Cell Transplantation for Early-Stage Osteonecrosis of the Femoral Head

Trial_Design.evidence: Phase III, multicenter, randomised, double-blind controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Adult patients with ARCO Stage I and II ONFH

Intervention.evidence: core decompression combined with autologous osteoblastic cell transplantation versus placebo

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the efficacy of core decompression combined with autologous osteoblastic cell transplantation versus placebo in patients with early-stage osteonecrosis of the femoral head (ONFH)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite treatment response at 24 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by ARCO stage, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixty-eight patients were randomised between December 2011 and February 2019

Number_Analysed.evidence: 25 in the study group and 29 in the control group analysed using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: no significant difference in composite treatment response between the study (61%) and control groups (69%; p = 0.54)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were rare and mild, with no serious events related to treatment

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under ClinicalTrials.gov NCT01529008

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by Bone Therapeutics SA
